title: Of Funerals and Fish
description: Three childhood friends get together in old age to discuss life and philosophy.

title: The Lost Key
description: The Trio spend the day trying to find a way to get back into the library after it closes to retrieve the key to Compo's place which fell out of his pocket there.

title: Inventor of the Forty Foot Ferret
description: Atheist Compo is challenged to sit in a church for 5 minutes without saying anything.

title: Pâté and Chips
description: The Trio arranges for a field trip to a historical home where they end up baby sitting the children of Chip & Connie, relatives of Compo.

title: Compo's Suit
description: Compo starts acting strangely, including cleaning his house and cleaning himself up as well.

title: The 30's Car
description: Clegg gets it in his mind to buy a car but he has to get past the tractors first.

title: Hail Smiling Morn or Thereabouts
description: Inspired by a local art show of photography, the Trio decide to go camping and take some artful photos of their own.

title: Forked Lightning
description: Clegg is having difficulties with his bicycle and even more so trying to get it fixed. Finally Sid takes a look and we are treated to a "Summer Wine" version of "Butch Cassidy & The Sunshine Kid"

title: Who's That Dancing with Nora Batty Then?
description: Two new librarians arrive and are bent on keeping the morality of the library ... And Compo's neighbor Sylvia is moving to Australia, and Compo sees an opportunity to get his arms around Nora without risking getting hit

title: The Changing Face of Rural Blamire
description: Thinking they have to much free time on their hands the trio decides to find some kind of occupation. They come across a dodgy bankrupted dealer who persuades them to sell his new product, with disastrous results, particularly for Blamire.

title: Some Enchanted Evening
description: Compo is in open pursuit of Nora and Wally seizes his chance to try a run for freedom, Compo sees a chance to. "comfort" Nora - too bad Nora wants nothing to do with their plans.

title: A Quiet Drink
description: The trio tries to persuade a tight fisted man to buy a round of drinks. For that they elaborate a very peculiar plan.

title: Ballad for Wind Instruments and Canoe
description: The Trio meet a man on the river who has lost his canoe. They find it, port it for the gent and then have to retrieve it from the river when they decide to take an unauthorized trip of their own. Ivy wins a prize for having the best mouth-instrument

title: Northern Flying Circus
description: Compo takes up motorcycling much to the surprise of Blamire and Clegg.

title: The Man from Oswestry
description: Compo is missing Blamire, we learn from him, that Cyril Blamire has gone to live in Oswestry, after hearing a lady he is interested in has become a widow. Clegg has received a letter from Balmire, this letter asks the to meet someone off the bus. This someone is to be Foggy Dewhurst, whom they knew from their childhood and youth, he was a corporal sign writer, but now civilian. He is returning home to Arnold crescent, but no longer has any living relatives to meet.He arrives loaded with keepsake metal signs. Within a short time of meeting up with Foggy, Clegg announces Foggy is a "genuine 14 carat gilt edged barm pot". Foggy has fight fight in a pub with one of Compos many cousins, we don't see it, but despite Foggy boasts it last very little time, and the cousin comes in unscathed, unlike Foggy. The trio is now established.

title: Mending Stuart's Leg
description: Sid and Ivy never had children, and Ivy is disappointed in the way their life has turned out due, she feels, to Sid's lack of ambition. She wants Sid to fix the café roof. Compo and Clegg take Foggy to the library, to Foggy's indignation, this becomes the first time he has ever been thrown out of a library. The trio meet up with Stuart,he has a troublesome leg, They all go to the café, where they all, including Sid, have a look at Stuarts leg, and then a listen for the click it makes, incurring Ivy's wrath. They try to fix the roof for her, but as you would expect it all goes very wrong.

title: The Great Boarding-House Bathroom Caper
description: Vacation subplot part 1: The Trio decide to take vacation near the seashore with Ivy and Sid in tow - the three share a room and find some unexpected friends in the hostel where they stay as well.

title: Cheering Up Gordon
description: Vacation subplot part 2:the Trio meet Gordon and exchange fishing lessons for "how to pick up birds" lessons, and Compo finds dates for everyone - which they weren't expecting. The husbands and wives have differing ideas of a vacation.

title: The Kink in Foggy's Niblick
description: Back from vacation the Boys decide to take up a sport, Foggy brags of his golfing past but when they hunt up his clubs they leave a lot to be desired, but Compo finds a new way to earn a bit of money

title: Going to Gordon's Wedding
description: Gordon is said to be Compo's nephew and he is getting married - but when the Best Man is injured it's Compo to the rescue with hilarious results

title: Isometrics and After
description: After getting winded on their morning romp, Foggy decides that they need to get in shape by exercise - and the librarian has found a new playmate

title: Ferret Come Home
description: Compo's favorite ferret has escaped not just from its cage, but from his house and he suspects that it is in Wally & Nora Batty's place but Nora won't let Compo anywhere near the place to look. How will he ever get it back?

title: Jubilee
description: Foggy feels the need to do something special for the Queen's Jubilee so he volunteers himself, Clegg, and Compo to help with the towns pageant/parade ... Now if only they can find someone who can drive a tractor

title: Flower Power Cut
description: After attending a funeral of an old friend Clegg tries to convince Foggy & Compo that flowers have emotions and that they react to vocal tone and music; Compo has a new plan for driving Nora into his arms

title: Who Made a Bit of Splash in Wales Then?
description: Foggy is off in Wales visiting his lady-friend who lives with her Mother-in-law for a fortnight. Clegg decides to rent a car and drives himself, Compo, Sid, and Ivy (who wants to visit her sister) up to meet her, but he manages to break Foggy's foot; the mother-in-law prefers Compo over Foggy.

title: A Merry Heatwave
description: It's an incredibly warm Christmas season but Nora is very sad - her brother Billy in Australia isn't expected to see another Christmas ... So Foggy decides to send a home movie to him of one

title: Small Tune on a Penny Wassail
Full Steam Behind
description: Foggy takes Cleggy and Compo to see a refurbished steam train, but can they catch it in time?

title: Deep in the Heart of Yorkshire
Here We Go into the Wild Blue Yonder
Here We Go Again into the Wild Blue Yonder
And a Dewhurst Up a Fir Tree
Whoops
description: With Christmas approaching, the trio decide to invite long-lost friends from the town for a drink at the pub on Christmas Eve.

title: In the Service of Humanity
description: Foggy decides to become a one-man rescue and assistance service, but his efforts don't quite produce the intended result.

title: Car and Garter
description: Foggy takes it in his head that the Trio must help Ivy's image of Sid and convince Weasley to use him in his latest experiment ... But when Ivy gives her opinion Compo steps in for the price of a flash of Nora's garters - and she has a special surprise for him as well

title: The Odd Dog Men
description: Foggy convinces Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily walks ... But it turns out to be more of a workout than anyone imagined

title: A Bicycle Made for Three
description: Deciding they need a bicycle each, the trio venture to old friend Dirk's (né Percy) shop, hoping for a bargain. Meanwhile, the café has been redecorated and is set for a grand re-opening.

title: One of the Last Few Places Unexplored by Man
Serenade for Tight Jeans and Metal Detector
description: Against his will, Clegg has been sold a metal detector. Foggy decides to show Clegg how valuable a piece of equipment it is, while Compo struggles with a new pair of jeans.

title: From Wellies to Wet Suit
description: Compo buys Sid's wetsuit and, supervised by Foggy, tries his hand at scuba diving and water-skiing.

title: All Mod Conned
description: Sid & Wally have to deal with their wives alone when Foggy books a seaside Christmas get away for himself, Compo, & Clegg ... But it's Compo who's properly dressed for the occasion

title: The Frozen Turkey Man
description: During their quest to find a treacle tin full of 'Yorkshire remains' Compo and a friend buried as children, the trio resort to ever more elaborate methods of approaching the problem. Taking a break in the pub, Compo and Clegg convince the barmaid that Foggy is an eccentric millionaire, having made his fortune in the frozen turkey business.

title: The White Man's Grave
description: The trio devise an elaborate plan to allow Wally to escape the wrath of Nora Batty for an afternoon. Unfortunately, they need an equally elaborate plan to sneak him back to the house.

title: The Waist Land
description: After stumbling across a health farm on a day out, the trio decide there's money to be made in selling junk food to the residents.

title: Cheering Up Ludovic
description: The trio encounter a very drunk Ludovic in a pub, and agree to drive his newly-acquired van home for him. Unfortunately, the van is also rather worse for wear.

title: The Three Astaires
description: Foggy has volunteered the trio's services in the upcoming variety show being held at a local church, but Clegg is unenthusiastic and Compo is rather more interested in the contents of the costume hamper.

title: The Arts of Concealment
description: Foggy's attempts at showing Clegg and Compo the arts of concealment aren't impressing anyone. But when assisting a passing motorist has unfortunate consequences for Compo, Foggy resorts to more basic methods of concealment.

title: Getting Sam Home
description: Three old chums agree to take the ailing Sam on one last trip to see his flousy girl-friend, Lily Bless Her, in the middle of the night. While enjoying the delights of Lilly, Sam departs for another world with a very happy smile on his face. The problem for his pals is how to get Sam back home before morning without his wife awakening.

title: The Loxley Lozenge
description: The trio agree to help Wesley bring his prize discovery, a Loxley Lozenge, back to his workshop. However, towing it home isn't easy and isn't helped by Clegg's phobia of driving.

title: The Mysterious Feet of Nora Batty
description: The size of Nora's feet becomes an point of contention between Foggy & Compo ... When interrogating Wally yields no information, the Boys take to finding out for themselves whether Nora has big feet or if it's all stocking!

title: Keeping Britain Tidy
description: Foggy finds a discarded mattress and embarks on a campaign to clean up the area.

title: Enter the Phantom
description: Compo borrows Crusher's red motorcycle racing leathers and becomes The Phantom, in order to impress Norah Batty on a picnic.

title: Catching Digby's Donkey
description: On their morning walk, Foggy, Compo, and Clegg notice neighbor Digby chasing his donkey around his paddock. Foggy puts his foot in everyone's mouth when he claims that all it takes is a bit of planning to catch the beast - and then volunteers the group to do it.

title: The Woollen Mills of Your Mind
description: In a bid to impress Nora Batty, Compo starts training for the Yorkshire Marathon under Foggy's tuition, but it doesn't quite go as planned.

roles.char: Lady trying to cross the street

title: Who's Looking After the Cafe Then?
description: Ivy has an appointment but with no one to supervise Crusher she decides to shut down the café for the day - but Foggy thinks she is over reacting, so the trio "supervise" things ... Now if only there was someone to supervise them.

title: Uncle of the Bride
description: Wesley & Edie's daughter Glenda is getting married, and Clegg and Compo make a new friend in Edie's brother Seymour. Foggy has left to take over an egg decorating business he inherited.

title: Why Does Norman Clegg Buy Ladies' Elastic Stockings?
The Heavily Reinforced Bottom
description: Inspired by Crusher's hobby, with Norman's help, Seymour tries to force Compo to take up canoeing to put him into some type of acceptable physical condition.

title: Dried Dates and Codfanglers
description: Compo accidentally discards his long treasured "gift" from Nora Batty. Seymour demonstrates his new home security device.

title: The Really Masculine Purse
description: Seymour has a new invention for men and volunteers Compo to test the product, which causes minor havoc through the village.

title: Who's Feeling Ejected Then?
description: Seymour tempts Compo to play guinea pig in his latest invention endeavor by giving him the title "executive in charge of testing", and promising to invite Nora Batty to the public demonstration.

title: The Ice-cream Man Cometh
description: Compo's craving for an ice cream prompts Seymour to design an vendor's side car cooler to put Compo into business.

title: Go with the Flow
description: Norman is visited by teenage missionaries. Seymour is given the task of selling tickets to the church charity costume presentation of "The Tales of Beatrix Potter".

title: Jaws
description: Wally's war-buddy and fellow pigeon racer Eli makes an appearance, and clears the pub; Compo pretends to be Wally so Nora won't be upset that he stopped to chat with Eli; Seymour sets Edie up with his own version of a garbage-disposal.

title: Edie and the Automobile
description: The village pedestrians and motorists are in peril as Seymour's sister Edie tries to learn to drive after having failed several driver tests.

title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
Big Day at Dream Acres
description: Compo, Clegg and Seymour happen upon a somewhat wiley tramp, who persuades them to help him rescue his childhood donkey (from better days), from a field. In fact the tramp wants to fix the 'donkey derby' at the local garden fete.

title: The Experiment
description: Compo wonders why people do not feel blood rush to their feet when they stand up so Seymour sets up another one of his odd experiments. A few of the village women have an afternoon tea and gossip party.

title: The Treasure of the Deep
description: In the canal, the trio find what Seymour claims to be "Georgian Silver". They experiment with different methods to recover what treasure may yet be hiding in the depths.

title: That Certain Smile
description: Seymour, Campo, and Clegg visit their friend Clem in hospital after his hernia operation, but they find the best medicine has to be snuck into his room.

title: The Day of the Welsh Ferret
Oh Shut Up and Eat Your Choc-Ice
Who's That Bloke with Nora Batty Then?
Getting Barry Higher in the World
What's Santa Brought for Nora Then?
Return of the Warrior
description: Seymour leaves for a new teaching job and Foggy Dewhurst makes his return, he can't find Compo or Clegg but the little village soon learns he's back- and the ladies coffee group decide trouble comes in threes.

title: Come in Sunray Major
description: Foggy has Wesley fix a pair of old WW2 walkie-talkies and he has Clegg and Compo take one out for a test, but a tractor mangles Compo's and he and Clegg have to come up with a way to explain the mistake without upsetting Foggy - enter Howard & Marina to the rescue!

title: Walking Stiff Can Make You Famous
That's Not Captain Zero
description: A carnival has come to town but the main attraction, Captain Zero, has broken down along the side of the road - good thing Foogy and friends are there to... help?

title: Das (Welly) Boot
description: Clegg moves into his new house and Compo decides to impress Nora with his water-rescue skills, and Foggy becomes Ivy's new Fix-It-Man... and Barry has misplaced his car's engine.

title: The Empire That Foggy Nearly Built
The Last Surviving Maurice Chevalier Impression
description: Compo goes on a televised talent show to impress Nora Batty

title: Roll On
description: Foggy enters Compo, Clegg, and himself in the local "Barrel Rolling Contest" where people crawl into empty oil drums and then are set rolling from the top of a large hill. Pearl buys Howard a gift - a tropical fish tank.

title: Quick, Quick, Slow
description: Compo tries to come to terms with Smiler being Nora's lodger.

title: Give Us a Lift
description: The trio develop an easier way to go up hill. Howard and Marina go bird watching.

title: Was That Nora Batty Singing?
description: Compo thinks that he hears Nora Batty happily singing so he obsessively spies on her imagining that she is having a romance with her lodger, Smiler.

title: Cashflow Problems
description: Compo is short of cash and decides to collect old debts.

title: Passing the Earring
description: Howard finds one of Marina's earrings caught in his jumper and is desperate to get it out of the house before Pearl sees it. Norman, Compo, Foggy and Smiler try to help.

title: Pole Star
description: Compo is envious of Smiler because Nora Batty has asked him to help around the house. Foggy thinks that he can break Compo out of a pouty mood by teaching him pole-vaulting to impress the ladies.

title: Situations Vacant
description: The trio start a courier service. Wesley fails to keep clean.

title: By the Magnificent Thighs of Ernie Burniston
description: Norman, Compo and Foggy attempt to help Howard deliver a birthday card to Marina without Pearl finding out. Compo is a bit jealous of local athlete Ernie Burniston.

title: Errol Flynn Used to Have a Pair Like That
Phantom of the Graveyard
description: Pearl is forcing Howard to wear horribly garish clothing so that he will hide from Marina. Compo is uncharacteristically dapper in a new suit as he plans to attend the funeral of a former teacher.

title: Camera Shy
description: Howard goes into full panic when he thinks that Foggy has videotaped him kissing Marina.

title: Have You Got a Light Mate?
Concerto for Solo Bicycle
description: Compo decides to take his bicycle out of storage, although it is in need of some basic safety repairs. The spectacle of Compo careening downhill without brakes inspires Foggy's inventive side. He enlists Wesley's help in building an invention to improve general bicycle safety, which of course Compo gets to test. Howard is worried that Pearl is attracted to a taller man, and tries several futile methods of increasing his height. Auntie Wainwright is keen on getting Smiler to make a delivery so she can collect on the sale, but Smiler becomes hesitant when he learns who the customer is. Glenda persuades the ladies to have a picnic lunch, but of course with Edie behind the wheel, no one enjoys the drive in the country. Their picnic spot is determined when they simply refuse to travel any further, and they soon find that the location is not as secluded as they might have wished.

title: There Are Gypsies at the Bottom of Our Garden
Aladdin Gets on Your Wick
description: Foggy attempts to invent a new watercraft. Auntie Wainwright forces Smiler to take her unethical business practices on the road. Howard comes up with yet another bizarre idea for an extramarital tryst with Marina.

title: The Man Who Nearly Knew Pavarotti
The Defeat of the Stoneworm
description: Pearl catches Howard behaving oddly in the cellar. He lies claiming that he is looking for "stone-worm", leaving the ladies to wonder if the village is infested. Foggy sets Compo on a mouse catching mission in a haberdasher's shop.

title: The Most Powerful Eyeballs in West Yorkshire
Leaving Home Forever, or Till Teatime
The First Human Being to Ride a Hill
Beware of the Elbow
description: Foggy and Norman think that Compo has lost his mind because he sees a floating fat lady. Glenda tries to convince her mother, Edie, to get new glasses.

title: A Double for Howard
description: The men take their pleasure tormenting a salesman by steering him toward women that they know will give him trouble. Howard again attempts to shake Pearl off his adulterous trail.

title: There Goes the Groom
description: Compo, Clegg and Truly chase a reluctant groom all through the village and beyond to stop him from escaping his wedding. Meanwhile, hungover best man Barry is frantically trying to locate the missing wedding ring.

title: Beware of the Oglethorpe
description: Howard is roaming free in the village despite Pearl's efforts to keep him occupied at home. The Cafe has a mysterious patron. Wesley is creating another machine.

title: Tarzan of the Towpath
description: One of Howard's "messages" is accidentally delivered to the wrong woman. Compo wants to prove that he can still do the things that he did as a nine year old.

title: Truly and the Hole Truth
description: Mr. Truely wants his name in the paper so he wanders through the village with Compo and Clegg looking for someone to save. Howard dresses to go "fishing", or so he told Pearl.

title: Oh Howard, We Should Get One of Those
description: Truly teaches Compo couples dance moves to impress Nora Batty. The ladies are sneaking around with bun tins. Wesley creates another weird machine. Auntie Wainwright puts a sandwich board on Eli and sends him to walk about the village.

title: The Only Diesel Saxophone in Captivity
description: Compo meets a childhood rival and blackmails him into competitions they did when they were eleven. Auntie Wainwright sells Barry a saxophone with a weird case.

title: Perfection - Thy Name Is Ridley
description: Compo is upset when Nora Batty cleans house for a strange man. When Wesley messes up Edie's car Compo fixes it.

title: Nowhere Particular
description: Howard buys a "secret" van, that everyone knows about. Truely thinks that Clegg is paying too high a tax so he drags Clegg to a council meeting. Auntie Wainwright has Smiler deliver a truck load of junk (in a hand cart) that the recipient did not order.

title: From Audrey Nash to the Widow Dilhooley
description: Marina has put Howard on notice, she is looking for a stable relationship. Wesley unveils his latest vehicle. Nora and Ivy go to the bus station to meet an old friend.

title: How Errol Flynn Discovered the Secret Scar of Nora Batty
description: Compo, Truly and Clegg meet Billy Hardcastle, who claims that he is a direct descendant of Robin Hood. Auntie Wainwright sells old golf clothing and clubs to Barry.

title: Who's Thrown Away Her Tom Cruise Photographs?
Will Barry Go Septic Despite Listening to Classical Music?
Howard Throws a Wobbler
description: Howard suspects Pearl is having an affair, so Truly organizes a crack surveillance team to identify the other man.

title: The Phantom Number 14 Bus
description: Truly investigates the mystery of the bus that disappeared between stops.

title: Ironing Day
description: Auntie Wainwright discovers a batch of homemade wine that causes trouble for Smiler and Howard.

title: Last Post and Pigeon
description: A trip to France to honour the dead from World War 2.

title: Lipstick and Other Problems
description: Auntie Wainwright tries to talk her way out of a speeding ticket. Barry is in trouble with Glenda because Marina kissed him again.

title: Elegy for Fallen Wellies
description: Nora Batty finally decides to give Compo a taste of what he's been asking for and it sends him to the hospital. Clegg, Nora, and friends need to deal with the loss of their friend.

title: Surprise at Throstlenest
description: Clegg gets a letter telling him Compo's arrangements for his ferrets and the Gang soon learns what Compo did with his Thursdays when he claimed to be 'exercising' his ferrets. And they learn just how devoted he was to Nora Batty.

title: From Here to Paternity
description: A letter arrives for Compo, and Nora takes it to Clegg. The letter is from Compo's long lost son. Clegg has to tell him his father is dead.

title: Some Vans Can Make You Deaf
Waggoners Roll
description: Barry's golf day is constantly interrupted. Howard promises to take Marina to lunch in public.

title: I Didn't Know Barry Could Play
Getting Barry's Goat
description: Tom Simmonite is board with village life. Mrs. Avery cleans out Compo's house. Barry lets Tom store a few "things" in his garage. A debt collector is looking for Tom.

title: The Art of the Shorts Story
The Missing Bus of Mrs Avery
Hey, Big Vendor
description: Barry becomes obsessed with his depression. Wesley invents an go anywhere hot drink dispenser which causes havoc at the church jumble sale and on the golf course.

title: Enter the Hawk
description: Auntie Wainwright takes some time off. Barry obtains a "secret suit". Pearl has a new plan to keep Howard at home.

title: Gnome and Away
description: Howard buys large gift and involves the other men in an attempt hide it from Pearl while delivering it to Marina. Glenda tells Barry that she wants a baby.

title: A Hair of the Blonde That Bit You
A White Sweater and a Solicitor's Letter
description: Barry flies a model plane. Billy buys a bow and arrows from Auntie Wainwright. A solicitor's letter arrives for the deceased Compo. Howard pretends to take an interest in tennis.

title: Why Is Barry at an Angle?
description: Pearl has Howard assembling furniture. Auntie Wainwright intends to rent out Smiler for children's parties. The men torment Barry with false stories about a client who is behind insurance payments.

title: The Coming of the Beast
description: To stave off boredom, Truly starts a rumor that a tiger is loose in the village.

title: Potts in Pole Position
description: Tom intends to to give Howard a "going fishing" excuse. Truly, Clegg and Billy meet a polar explorer with a domineering wife. Marina and Auntie Wainwright tart-up the explorer's wife. Pearl and Glenda go hunting for fishermen.

title: A Brief Excursion in the Fast Lane
description: Barry, having a mid-life crisis, is craving a more dangerous fast life.

title: The Mystical Squeak of Howard's Bicycle
description: Howard's bicycle develops an annoying, loud squeak when Pearl is around.

title: The Incredible Ordeal of Norman Clegg
description: Howard planned a picnic and has "stored" Marina at Norman's, but will not pick her up because the lady's morning coffee group is being hosted by Pearl and he is afraid to leave the house.

title: Beware of the Hot Dog
description: Pearl makes Howard jealous. Wesley attempts to enter the mobile catering trade.

title: In Search of Childlike Joy and the Farthest Reaches of the Lotus Position
description: Wesley convinces Smiler to test his latest invention, leading to the usual outcome. Howard and Marina have their usual bicycle disaster, perpetrated by Billy and involving Clegg and Truly. Barry attempts Yoga.

title: A Chaise Longue Too Far
description: Howard is trying to escape from Pearl, who is keeping him busy with home repair. Barry wants a gift for Glenda so Auntie Wainwright sells him a large chaise longue. Marina if fed-up with Howard.

title: It All Began with an Old Volvo Headlamp
description: The men try to build a reputation for their new friend, Kevin, as 'The Wise Man Of The Woods'.

title: A Musical Passing for a Miserable Muscroft
description: Billy Ingleton has obtained a garish van containing a small fairground organ that does not work well, but the women want to use it for the Huttersfield Fair, in twenty-four hours. Tom Simmonite plans to do his ventriloquist act for the Fair with Marina assisting, which upsets Howard.

title: The Lair of the Cat Creature
Ancient Eastern Wisdom - An Introduction
description: The episode that introduces Entwhistle, a cross-cultural character. It looks like the bill collector has finally caught up with Tom, but its Truly & Clegg to the rescue. Elsewhere, Howard finds himself inspired by a book to change his life - and falling into Billy's world! Evie is reminded of a fond childhood memory.

title: A Pick-up of the Later Ming Dynasty
description: The men try to help Smiler find a squeak in his hand cart. Barry gets drunk. Marina buys a camouflage net.

title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg
description: It's Clegg's birthday but he only wishes to have a simple lunch with his good friend Truly - no parties no fuss. So Truly & Clegg don their best suits for their lunch, and end up with an extra guest. Everyone else goes to a wedding but end up at the same restaurant as Clegg. Will here able to keep his secret?

title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream
The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell
The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff
The Second Husband and the Showgirls
description: Truly must meet the new man in the Former Mrs. Truelove's life; Auntie Wainwright sets Tom and Smiler on a date with former showgirls.

title: A Short Blast of Fred Astaire
Jurassic - No Parking
description: Howard is in a dilemma, he needs to get a gift for Marina's birthday but he can't get out of the house, so Truly & Billy agree to find something special. Barry wins a prize which arrives at the house while he's at work, so Glenda calls him home right away.

title: The General's Greatest Battle
description: It is the annual parade to commemorate Hero of the Battle of Mazurka, and Auntie has hired Tom and Smiler to deliver the star of the show - which of course means all the men need to get involved. Meanwhile, Marina asks Clegg to deliver a message to Howard and seals it with a kiss - causing Clegg to forget what it is.

title: Spores
description: While walking along the road, Clegg, Truly, and Billy run into a "damsel in distress" - she lost her husband. They take her to Pearl to cheer up while they hunt for her husband - the most depressing man in the world. Meanwhile, Nora's new neighbor, Alvin, tries all day to get a photo of Nora smiling but she's having nothing to do with it - being as suspicious of him as she was with Compo.

title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda? - It's Not Barry and Glenda
description: Barry has been sneaking around, and Glenda asks Trult & company to find out if there is another woman involved. Barry confesses to TheBoys what's going on but now he's afraid that Glenda has begun to sneak men to the house while he's at work, so he asks them to find out if there is another bloke.

title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer But Only Part Time
description: Barry's acting skills are needed to save Clegg when he gets kidnapped by Smiler's new girlfriend after Smiler breaks up with her.

title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter
Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats
description: While trying to talk Nora Batty into a bike ride, Alvin discovers that Nora and her best-friend Audrey had a tiff several years earlier when Audrey laughed at Nora's hat. Alvin enlists the help of Truly, Billy, Howard, and Marina to get them back together. Glenda hires a caddy for Barry.

title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful
description: Truly just can't get the hang of his new cell phone, he keeps missing a persistent caller and Billie takes the advantage to make Truly believe his ex-wife has come looking for him. Howard and Marina are smoking hot.

title: Variations on a Theme of the Widow Winstanley
description: Feeling too old for a bicycle, Howard purchases a "secret" car. Barry is having a spiritual crisis.

title: The Swan Man of Ilkley
description: Alvin teaches Nora Batty to line-dance and soon all the ladies in the coffee clutch are joining in. Howard & Smiler each take up a new hobby. Barry goes golfing with the boss, who is awful at it.

title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?
description: Billy wants his sister-in-law to leave, so he and the Boys decide the best way is to hook her up with some gentleman friend, Alvin suggests Corcroft - but Truly thinks Corcroft needs to warm up on Nora Batty first. Clegg puts his old diaries into manuscript form.

title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?
description: After Truly sees a professor on the Telly that looks just like Smiler, Tom & Smiler set out to make him an Intellectual - which lends Smiler a date with Marina. Alvin asks for Nora's help to train for the Space Program.

title: Available for Weddings
description: After Clegg ends up with his foot in a plaster and an arm in a sling after a bike trip with Billy & Alvin, Truly and the Boys try to invent a bike that also an ATV. Barry gets bit by the camping bug.

title: The McDonaghs of Jamieson Street
description: Glenda shows Nora and Tom that she can drive just as well as her mother ever did. Howard is afraid that he his showing his age, so he goes on a quest to make his appearance more youthful (and we learn a little about he & Pearl's courting days). Smiler is longing for the woman he fell in love with during the war, so Clegg enlists the Boys to find her - but the street she used to lived on was torn down.

title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager
description: Clegg is trying to remember the name of a supervisor from his days of working at the Co-Op but no one knows who is is talking about so Truly & company try to hunt down some one who might remember and in the process Marina vows to keep herself chaste (at least in public). Mr. Tins dale (the repo man) tries to get a cuddle from his wife.

title: Lot No. 8
description: Auntie blind buys "Lot 8" from a catalog which describes it as consisting of 4 very useful containers ... Although Auntie finds that people probably won't buy them, Truly, Tom, and Alvin find a use for them - as a derby car! Glenda is upset that Barry looks married.

title: Little Orphan Howard
description: What started as a joke takes on a life of it's own when Clegg tells Howard that he was adopted and that his real parents were dead. Alvin is very insistent that he will get a kite to fly - and finds several ways to try to get it done.

title: Follow That Bottle
description: Hanging out along the creekside, Truly and the Boys spot a bottle with a note in it floating down the river so of course Alvin & Billie have to try to get the bottle. A stranger is looking for Clegg - a phone call from Pearl sends Clegg into a worry.

title: How to Remove a Cousin
description: Clegg's cousin Aubrey moves in uninvited and takes over Norm's life, so the Boys help to free him; Howard mistakes Nora Batty for Marina.

title: Has Anyone Seen Barry's Midlife Crisis?
description: Howard is on 24-hr "lock down" by Pearl, so his friends accept the challenge to help him escape. Barry thinks he's missing out on something because he feels contented with his life; Entwistle has too much fun with his dog.

title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi
description: Marina wants to get in shape; the librarian is trying to get a romantic novel study group together; Billy goes looking for the perfect place to have an old-fashioned barbecue.

title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie
description: Miss Davenport makes a pass at Barry and now he refuses to go back to the library; Pearl spots a personal ad in the paper and figures it's Howard setting up a meeting with Marina; Alvin decides to make Nora jealous.

title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?
description: Howard wants to learn to fly; Barry gets an answer to his ad looking for Merry Men, but the applicant isn't quite what he expected. Barry refuses to leave the stairs in his home.

title: Who's That Talking to Lenny?
description: Clegg and crew are out for their daily walk when they notice that Lenny (the Swan Man) is back in town, this time following a strange voice. Howard begins an etymology club, consisting of two members.

title: Oh Look! Mitzi's Found Her Mummy
description: Howard promises to take care of Mitzi, but Pearl wont let heron the houses she spends the day at Clegg's but she won't let let the Boys stay indoors. Barry & gland find costumes for a party.

title: Plenty of Room in the Back
description: Auntie breaks down and buys Tom & Smiler some new transport, and they find it helps to sober people up. Glenda wants Barry to think for himself.

title: The Second Stag Night of Doggy Wilkinson
description: An old friend, Doggy, is almost 80 and getting married again - so The Boys take him out for his bachelors party complete with arranged special lady ... But what starts out as a boring dry affair soon gets pronounced as "better than my first stag" by the groom.

title: What Happened to the Horse?
description: What starts out as a good joke on Howard gets a life of it's own when Truly invents a ghost story that involves a local wooden area.

title: Variations on a Theme of Road Rage
description: Howard feels he has out grown the bicycle so he purchases a car from a woman who says it reminds her too much of her late-husband.

title: In Which Howard Gets Double Booked
description: Howard decides it's time to take Pearl out for a dinner to the "Fox and Duck" - so Pearl invites Nelly to come with, and Truly invites Marina to go with, now if only Howard knew about it.

title: Will the Nearest Alien Please Come In
description: Science-fiction addict Kevin believes aliens from outer space may have landed. Truly, Clegg and Alvin help to convince him he is right.

title: Elegy for Small Creature and Clandestine Trackbike
description: Howard has purchased a track bike and is desperate to hide it from Pearl.

title: The Crowcroft Challenge
description: Alvin and Truly tie one on in a bar and Alvin volunteers to complete the Crowcroft Challenge - a task that has never been completed. Howard volunteers when he realizes that he might be able to get together with Marina during the Challenge.

title: Must Be Good Dancer
description: Tom decides that Smiler should answer an add looking for a dance partner so Truly and gang decide to turn him into "Fred Astaire"; Barry has Glenda help him find the mysterious squeak in his car.

title: In Which Howard Remembers Where He Left His Bicycle Pump
description: Pearl, Miss Davenport, Nora Batty, Nelly, Ivy, and Glenda have entered a baking contest. Howard runs into an old flame while out with Truly, so he takes it upon himself to help the two get back together.

title: Sinclair and the Wormley Witches
description: While standing on a hillside admiring the view, Alvin, Truly, and Entwistle get stoned by a stranger. Smiler does some witchcraft. Pearl & Nelly track Howard.

title: Enter the Finger
description: Barry's fitness-mad neighbour annoyingly outshines him in all things physical. When it comes to karate, however, Barry has friends who can help him even the balance.

title: Will the Genuine Racer Please Stand Up?
description: Howard dresses Tom up in racing gear, complete with helmet, and makes sure Pearl sees him so that he can use the disguise later to meet Marina - but others think he is Tom as well and Howard finds out just how busy and challenging Tom's day can be. Glenda has her own annoying neighbor to deal with.

title: A Short Introduction to Cooper's Rules
description: Barry's aunt asks him to take a retired vicar to lunch with some of the boys, which neither of them really wish to do ...but when the vicar runs away it becomes the most exciting luncheon ever.

title: Is Jeremy Quite Safe?
description: While Tom is cleaning out the back room he discovers a safe which Auntie has forgotten about for many years - now, not only can't she remember what's inside, but she has forgotten the combination as well! It's a good thing that Miss Davenport and Marina know a retired jewel thief.

title: All That Glitters Is Not Elvis
description: After running into a man who is convinced that not only is Elvis alive, but in the village area, Alvin decides to play a wonderful joke on Howard; Barry misplaces his boss's dog in the park.

title: Eva's Back in Town
description: Howard feels that his life is in a rut and nothing exciting ever happens - until Alvin convinces an old chum, Eva, to help him play a joke on Howard, but the result is Howard going on the run.

title: In Which Romance Isn't Dead - Just Incompetent
description: Alvin & Entwistle offer Howard advice on how to romance Pearl again; Barry helps his neighbor, Mr. Chiselhurst try to romance Miss Davenport.

title: The Mischievous Tinkle in Howard's Eyes
Of Passion and Pizza
description: Merv has a crush on the pizza lady, but he hasn't the nerve to ask her out; the Gang can't resist, they have to help him out - which just gets Howard into trouble.

title: It's Never Ten Years
description: Clegg and Truly tell Alvin about their old friend Compo and his escapades making an impression on Alvin's current neighbor, Nora Batty.

title: Get Out of That, Then
description: Lenny is trying out a new show business career as an escapist. The problem is he's not very good at it.

title: I Was a Hitman for Primrose Dairies
description: Clegg hears his new neighbor - retired milkman Luther 'Hobbo' Hobdyke - has strong links to MI5 and the secret service. Although he recalls his adventurous past as a spy to Alvin and Entwistle, they know him better for not having been a particularly good milkman - but Hobbo insists the dairy work was merely a therapeutic measure to alleviate combat stress.

title: Some Adventures of the Inventor of the Mother Stitch
description: While Morton is still depressed over his divorce, Hobbo attempts to find a good friend for him. Meanwhile Barry is depressed to find that Toby is moving next door to him and cements ill-will when he breaks Toby's lamp.

title: The Mother of All Mistakes - Or Is It?
description: Adopted as a baby, Hobbo is determined to trace his natural mother. He has found out her name and exactly where she lives, but how should he approach the poor woman to tell her the good news? Meanwhile, Howard is in trouble when Marina, on finding out that he has been making inquiries about another woman, turns up at his house. As Hobbo passes Howard's house, he makes an astonishing discovery.

title: Will Howard Cross the Atlantic Single Handed?
Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?
Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat
description: Howard is unnerved by Pearl's unexplained Day Outings with Nellie. Hobbo helps to follow them in order to find out once and for all. But Howard finds the answer more troubling than the question and must intervene disguised as a mobster to give his presence some clout- driven in Entwhistle's pickup.

title: Will Stella Find True Love with Norris Fairburn?
Will Randolph Make a Good Impression?
In Which Romance Springs a Leak
Variations on a Theme of Father's Day
Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard
description: Hobbo decides to enlist Morton Beamish's help in re-uniting Toby with his wife. However Toby's wife takes quite a liking to Morton, a fact he'll have to hide from Toby. Meanwhile Mis Davenport is attracted to Hobbo, to his dismay.

title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard)
description: Howard is missing home, and Hobbo concocts various schemes to have Pearl take Howard back. Meanwhile, Barry is missing his hearty meals and Toby and Morton lament being divorced.

title: How Not to Cry at Weddings
